results.title: Jirrupin Bunggul 'Happy Dance'
results.brief_description: Winner of the ‘Make a stamp come alive’ category of Screen It! This cool little work combines a thumping dance track with animation of the artwork depicted on an Australian stamp entitled ‘Aboriginal Culture: Music and Dance’. An animated short entered to ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Eureka
results.brief_description: Highly commended entry into the “Make a stamp come alive” category of Screen It! This film recounts the story of famous revolt in Ballarat and the subsequent discovery of gold. An animated short entered to ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Freedom of the Boomerang
results.brief_description: Highly commended ” make a stamp come alive” entry to Screen It! A man visiting a post office unwittingly unleashes a magical boomerang into the world. An animated short entered to ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Animated Stamp - [Mitchell Gaffney]
results.brief_description: Asked to “make a stamp come to life”. Mitchell has created a vibrant, multicolored traffic flow in a stamp featuring Sydney Harbour Bridge. The price of the stamp rises as the increase of traffic flow occurs across the bridge. Highly Commended. An animated short entered to ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

group.title: Stamps coming to life: Anderson Creek Primary School

results.title: Then and Now
results.brief_description: Recounts the story of the Gaganja tribe and of an Aboriginal elder’s experience of white people entering his land.It compares the early conflict of settlement with the situation in Australia today. Winner of the category “Create a moving image stamp story” An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Story of Henry Handel Richardson
results.brief_description: This animated short was highly commended in the “Create a Stamp Story” section of the Screen It! competition. Henry Handel Richardson was the pseudonym of Ethel Florence Lyndsey Richardson; this stamp story is about her achievements in music and literature. An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Early Communication in Australia
results.brief_description: Challenged to create a moving image work on the theme ‘Pacific Explorer’, this highly commended work uses Australian stamps with historical and Aboriginal themes to narrate the methods and ways Australians have communicated over time. An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Moments in Time
results.brief_description: In response to the challenge “Create a moving image work on the theme ‘Pacific Explorer’” these students came up with a highly entertaining magazine style ‘TV show’ featuring a story on an old lady and her memories of her family’s early days in Australia.An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Australia: the encounter
results.brief_description:
Recounts the story of Matthew Flinder’s circumnavigation around Australia, his trials across the Tasman, involvement with the Nagarrindjeri tribe and his encounters with a French explorer. The Aboriginal people clash with these “white ghosts”. On his way home to England, Flinders is imprisoned in Mauritius and his prized cat, Trim is killed. A decade later, Flinders returns home to his family. Meanwhile, the violence upon Aboriginal sacred lands continues.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.
